Robert CHATFIELD was born in 1693 in Ardingly, Sussex West, England. He was christened on 3 May 1693 in St Peter, Ardingly, Sussex West, England. He died on 30 January 1741 at the age of 48 in Cuckfield, Sussex West, England. Robert was buried in Holy Trinity Churchyard, Cuckfield, Sussex West, England. England Births and Christenings

=====

Of Bentley, yeoman. Exor. to fr, but a minor, 27 Sep 1707. Found his hr and

admd to "Mercers" at Wakehurst Ct. 26 Aug 1708, then aged 15. Will dt 9 Jan

1737, prd 21 Feb 1740 (Lewes A56. 16). Mentions bro-in-law John Lucas.

A. 56 fo. 161Extract of Robert's will dated 9 July 1737 and proved 21 Feb 1741 by Robert Chatfield

Robert Chatfield of Bentley, Cuckfield, yeoman wife Sarah whose maiden name is Burtenshaw-1st wife Sarah Attree marriage settlement 31 may 1723--my youngest son William Chatfield & son of my 1st wife Sarah Attree, my daughter Mary Chatfield one of said 1st wife children son Robert Chatfield executor-brother William Chatfield & brother-in-law John Lucas guardian of 3 children.

John Lucas of Barcombe married Mary Attree sister of Sarah Attree

2nd wife Sarah named nephews James & John Burtenshaw sons of brothers John and Richard. Dated 12 Dec 1767 proved 23 Sept 1768 by James Burtenshaw exe

Tombstone churchyard Holy Trinity, Cuckfield, Sussex, England

In this same grave was buried Robert Chatfield of Bentley who died 30 Jan 1741 aged 41 years also Sarah 2nd wife of the above who died 17 Aug1763 aged 67.

Find A Grave Memorial# 101348848

Of Street, yeoman. Named in Uncle Richard Webb's will 1705, in grandfr Marten's

1706 and in fr's 1734/5. Will dt 22 Mar., prd 9 May 1741 (Lewes A56 150).

Exors. bro Michael, and bro-in-law Michael Marten of Keymer.

In 1793 mentioned in a lease of his grandson, Luke as formerly of Street, yeoman, deceased.

Parents: Robert CHATFIELD and Sarah MARTEN.

Spouse: Sarah LOOKER. Sarah LOOKER and Robert CHATFIELD were married about 1732 in Ditchling, Sussex East, England. Possibly married in the Meeting House, Ditchling.

Children were: Living, Joseph CHATFIELD, Sarah CHATFIELD.

Robert CHATFIELD was born on 26 March 1698 in Hanley, Sussex West, England. He was christened on 31 March 1698 in Cuckfield, Sussex West, England. He died on 24 September 1760 at the age of 62 in Cuckfield, Sussex West, England. Robert was buried on 30 September 1760 in Holy Trinity Churchyard, Cuckfield, Sussex West, England. Was surveyor of the Parish. Overseer 1744. Churchwarden 1754-6. Exor to Robert

Chatfield, of Bentley in Cuckfield 1757. By his will dtd 1766, prd 22 Oct 1767

(P.C.C. 367 Ledgard) devised copyhold land in Cuckfield held of the Manor of

Cuckfield Vicarage and copyhold in Keymer held of the Manor of Keymer to his

wife and then to his dau., Sarah Clutton.

Robert practised as a Surveyor for many years and although no records survive prior to 1744 it is reasonable to suppose that he was in business many years before that time.

Robert Chatfield had a son who died young, and a daughter, Sarah, who married William Clutton. William clearly worked hard and took over the business from his father in law, who retired in 1765. At this point the firm changed its name from Robert Chatfield to William Clutton.

Tombstone

In Memory of

Robert Chatfield

of Hanly

departed this life 24 Sept

1760

Aged 71 years

Also of Jane his Wife

who departed this life 14 March

1780

Aged 69 Years

Amended birth and baptism years to match death on tombstone.

Parents: Robert CHATFIELD and Katherine SAVAGE.

Spouse: Jane FIELD. Jane FIELD and Robert CHATFIELD were married on 18 June 1731 in Cuckfield, Sussex West, England. IGI

Indexing Project (Batch) Number: M01204-4

System Origin: England-EASy

Source Film Number: 2142086

Reference Number: it 2 p 78

Children were: Charles CHATFIELD, Sarah CHATFIELD, Jenny CHATFIELD.

Of Bentley, yeoman. Under 21 in fr's will and exor. 1737. Named as possible

trustee in uncle Walter's will 1745. Overseer of Cuckfield Parish 1746.

Churchwarden 1755. Hr and adminr to bro William 1756, but dead 12 Jul in that

yr. (Wakehurst Ct. Rolls). Will dt 16 Apr 1756. prd 6 May 1757 (Lewes A59.

448). Left moeity of Brantridge to Sarah, 2nd dau of John and Mary Lucas, of

Barcombe; and Broomfield and Coneycroft in Barcombe, to Lucy, her y'gest sr.

Exors John Lucas of Barcombe and Robert Chatfield of Handley.

Robert CHATFIELD was born in 1741 in Surrey, England. He was christened on 22 July 1741 in Ewell, Surrey, England. He died in February 1743 at the age of 2. Robert was buried on 13 February 1743 in St Mary & St Nicholas, Leatherhead, Surrey, England. Find A Grave Memorial# 139493802

Parents: Allen CHATFIELD and Sarah WOOD.Robert CHATFIELD was born on 23 July 1748 in Croydon, Surrey, England. He was christened on 2 August 1748 in Croydon, Surrey, England. He died on 21 May 1811 at the age of 62 in Croydon, Surrey, England. Robert was buried on 28 May 1811 in St John the Baptist, Croydon, Surrey, England. St. John the Baptist, Croydon, Surrey.

On a handsome white marble tablet, on the west wall â

Sacred to the memory of Robert Chatfield, Esq., who departed this life the xxi of May mdcccxi, aged lxiii years. Also of Ann, relict of the above, who departed this life the xxviii day of September, mdcccxxx, aged lxxv years.

-----

Find A Grave Memorial# 141763757

=====

Was awarded in lieu of right of Common 2a. 3r. 31p. on Thornton Heath, and 2a. 2r. 16p. on Croydon Common under Croydon Enclosure of Commons Award 1797.

J.P. for the Co. of Surrey. High Sherrif, 1805. Paymaster of Seamen's Wages to the H.E.I.C.

Will dated 2 June 1807, proved 1 June 1811 and 2 May 1812 (P.C.C.).

Robert Chatfield was a junior clerk in the Pay Office, Honourable East India Company in 1764. He was in the Honourable East India Company Service. He was 2nd Assistant to the Paymaster and Clerk to the Committee of Shipping in 1793. He was 1st Assistant to the Paymaster of Seamen's Wages in 1798. He held the office of Justice of the Peace (J.P.) for Surrey. He was Paymaster in 1802. He held the office of High Sheriff of Surrey in 1805. He lived at Croydon, Surrey, England. He lived at Cooper's Row, Hart Street, London, England.

http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk

Rev. Dr. Robert CHATFIELD was born on 2 October 1775 in Hove, Sussex East, England. He was christened on 24 October 1775 in St Olave, Hart St., London, England. He died on 10 September 1853 at the age of 77 in Brighton, Sussex East, England. Robert was buried on 16 September 1853 in Hove, Sussex East, England. Death GRO 3rd qtr 1853

Chatfield, Robert Brighton 2b 127

-----

CHATFIELD.-Sept. 10, at his residence, 7, Montpellier Crescent, Brighton, in the 78th year of his age, the Rev. Robert Chatfield, L.L.D., late vicar of Chatteris, and for more than 40 years a magistrate for the Isle of Ely and county of Cambridge.

Hereford Times, West Midlands, England. 17 Sep 1853.

Photo courtesy of John Gardner

-----

Rev Robert Chatfield

British Newspaper Archive, Family Notices

birth: 1775

death: 10 September 1853

obituary: 21 September 1853

United Kingdom

spouse: Susannah Money.

=====

Educ. at Emm. Coll. Camb. LL.B. 1805, LL.D. 1811. He graduated with a Doctor of Divinity (D.D.).

Vicar of Chatteris, Cambridgeshire, England.

1803-45. J.P. for Isle of Ely and Co. Cambridgeshire.

-----

A sermon preached at Chatteris, on Wednesday evening, November 19, 1817, on the occasion of the death of her lamented Royal Highness the Princess Charlotte Augusta, of Wales, and Saxe-Coburg' by the Rev R Chatfield, LL.D, Vicar of Chatteris and Chaplain to the Countess Dowager of Liverpool; 1817

-----

UNIVERSITY INTELLIGENCE.

Rev. Dr. Chatfield, vicar of Chatteris, gave his annual donation of beef and plum pudding to the scholars of the National School in that parish.

Cambridge Chronicle and Journal, East England. 02/01/1824

-----

COLLECTANEA.

..... , Mr. Chatfield, who is the son of the Rev. Dr. Chatfield, of Chatteris, and represented himself as the son of a person of the name of Stocks, who is head farming man to Dr. Chatfield, that he had hurt his hand by a machine, and that he was come to Cambridge, to Mr Chatfield who gave witness a sovereign to get changed, and desired him to give the prisoner a crown, whilst witness was obtaining change, Mr. Chatfield came to him, and stated, that he had just received a letter from Chatteris, and he believed, n, Mr.Chatfield gave the prisoner half-a-crown; a few days afterwards the prisoner made a second application, but suspicions of the accuracy of his story having been excited, he did not obtain more money. The learned counsel then called James Heath, the, to Mr. Chatfield, for money, and the statement made by the prisoner, and Mr. Chatfield's giving him half-a-crown; this was on Saturday the 23d of May. On Monday following, the prisoner applied a second time at the college gates, and witness carried a note, - Mr. Chatfield corroborated the testimony of Heath.- Samuel Stocks, the labouringman upon Dr. Chatfield's farm, [proved that the prisoner was "no son of his" (laughter)". The prisoner's name was Nehemiah Clark, witness has a son named Joseph, who was, of Dr. Chatfield. - Alderman Abbott proved examining the prisoner's hand ; there was a scratch on the thumb, but nothing to warrant his admission into the hospital. Mr. Payne, tbe gaoler, also proved that the prisoner's name was Nehemiah Clark.- Guilty

Huntingdon, Bedford & Peterborough Gazette, East England. 18/07/1829

-----

ISLE OF ELY.

Rev. Dr. Chatfield; and on the day preceding Christmas day a liberal supply beef and mutton was distributed to every poor family of that parish, by that benevolent gentleman; and it is hoped every poor person partook of a good dinner on Christmas day in, Rev Dr. Chatfield, on behalf of the -Benevolent Society 'held in that town. The portion of scripture from whence he chose his text,"was'the 4th -chapter of the First Epistle John, and part the 7th verse, Beloved, let love one ' another: for love of God.'

Huntingdon, Bedford & Peterborough Gazette, East England. 02/01/1830

Parents: Robert CHATFIELD and Ann STORROW.

Spouse: Susannah MONEY. Susannah MONEY and Rev. Dr. Robert CHATFIELD were married on 17 July 1800 in Much Marcle, Herefordshire, England. Marriage

Dr. Chatfield became connected with this county by marriage with Susannah, third surviving daughter of Wm. Money, Esq.,of Homme House, in the parish of Marcle; his family resided in Surrey, where his father filled the office of high sheriff.

Hereford Journal, West Midlands, England. 21/09/1853
